description: covered vase, porcelain, armorial, with crest surrounded by butterflies and pink roses, Chinese Export, XVIIIc (76.39.3.1ab) cat. card dims H 11-3/8 diam 4'
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: The arms on this pair of jars are of the Hotham and Morley families. The service was probably made for Sir Richard Hotham, who was managing owner of East Indiamen and had ten ships in Canton between 1765 and 1789.
title: Covered Vase
